required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Which Nostril Should be Used for Nasotracheal Intubation With Airtraq NT®: the Right or Left? A Randomized Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Which Nostril Should be Used for Nasotracheal Intubation With Airtraq NT®: the Right or Left? A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: After Ethics committee approval investigators decided to enroll 40 patients ASA I-II, 18-60 years of age undergoing maxillofascial, oral and double chin surgery to determine which nostril is more suitable for nasotracheal intubation with nasotracheal Airtraq. We primay aimed to compare the glottis visualization time, intubation time and total intubation times.

detailed_description.textblock: After Ethics committee approval, investigators decided to enroll 40 pateints ASA I-II, 18-60 years of age undergoing maxillofascial, oral and double chin surgery to determine which nostril is more suitable for nasotracheal intubation with nasotracheal Airtraq. In addition is the 90° anti-clockwise rotation of the tip of the tube helpful to insert the tube into the trachea. Patients were randomized into right and the left nostril groups. After standard anesthesia induction with propofol and fentanyl, rocuronium was used for muscle relaxation. Primary aim of this prospective study was to compare the glottis visualization time, intubation time and total intubation times. The Cormack-Lehane grades, the need for optimization, tube adjustment maneuvers, hemodynamic data, occurrence of epistaxis of the patients were recorded during the process.

primary_outcome.description: handling the device till the optimal glottis visualization occurred

primary_outcome.measure: nasotracheal intubation time with the device
primary_outcome.description: handling the device till the visualization of tracheal tube through the vocal cords

primary_outcome.measure: total nasotracheal intubation time with the device
primary_outcome.description: handling the device till the confirmation of nasotracheal intubation with end-tidal carbodioxide

secondary_outcome.measure: optimisation maneuvers during intubation with the device
secondary_outcome.description: need for optimisation maneuvers during nasotracheal intubation

secondary_outcome.measure: minor complications related to the device

arm_group.description: nasotracheal intubation with Airtraq NT through the right nostril
nasotracheal intubation with Airtraq NT through the left nostril

intervention.description: channeled video laryngoscope for nasotracheal intubation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-65 years of age
- undergoing elective maxillofacial surgery
- dental surgery
- plastic surgery requiring nasotracheal intubation
- ASA I-II
Exclusion Criteria:
- >18 years and > 65 years
- BMI> 35
- ASA III-IV
- fasted patients
- patients do not require nasotracheal intubation
